intro: Tanacetum abrotanoides, commonly known as tansy or golden button, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green composite flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and is known for its aromatic properties. Tanacetum abrotanoides has a long history of use in traditional medicine and as a garden ornamental.
